result.execSummary:
The defendant Amos Dennis Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA sucharge, all court costs.  All to be paid by 9/14/15 or the result will be a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

Provide a DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted feon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DRUG ABUSE CORRECTIONAL CENTER ATTN STEPHANIE P.O.BOX 36 WINNEBAGO WI 54985

Amendment to Judgment Of Conviction and Order- ERP signed and filed. Copies to the District Attorney's Office and Dept of Corrections.
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff will be based upon actual release date.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. Rosa Judge Rosa.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amos Dennis Thompson in court with attorney Cord Williams Klein.  Defendant Amos Dennis Thompson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson for Antonella Aleman  Statements by state, defense counsel and defendant.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS with 61 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the Substance Abuse program.  

Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample (pay the surcharge) and to pay all court costs. Court ordered that all costs be paid by 09/14/2015 or the result will be a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed,
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
-Written explanation of Determinate Sentence
-Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Amos Dennis Thompson in court with attorney Cord Williams Klein.  Defendant Amos Dennis Thompson in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Negotiations placed on the record. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant that he will need to provide a DNA sample.

Case adjourned to Branch 07.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status date is converted to a plea and sentencing date.

Attorney Cord Williams Klein in court, defendant Amos Dennis Thompson not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 06-29-2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of PRELIMNARY HEARING transcript commencing JUNE 1, 2015 received and filed. (11 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to CORD KLEIN, P.O. BOX 80139, MILWAUKEE, WI 5208-8002, PUBLIC DEFENDER APPOINTMENT. kl

Defendant Amos Dennis Thompson in court with attorney Cord Williams Klein.  Defendant Amos Dennis Thompson in custody.  Ronald Dague for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Chad Boyack-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Amos Dennis Thompson in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Amos Dennis Thompson in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MCADAMS, Branch 7.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
